channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2025020115
item.description:
Report E-2025020115

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2041ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSJ. It was reported that approximately 4-oz of Lacquer Thinner released from a metal pail due to unknown reasons. The release impacted concrete dock floor. XPO cleaned up the spill prior to notifying ERTS. A 5-gallon poly waste container was used for waste. ERTS generated waste ID 224452-1. ERTS notified Chemtrec, Esther provided report # 2024010900206.

item.title: Report X-2025020198
item.description:
Report X-2025020198

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD B. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAPS ON EACH OF THE INNER 1 GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON.

item.title: Report E-2025020038
item.description:
Report E-2025020038

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0830 ET, XPO-XSL notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 pint of Express alkali released from a plastic tote due to improper loading The release impacted inside trailer#. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined contractors' assistance would be necessary due to its haz class 8 corrosive and a tote Transfer. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of UN1824 Express Alkali product released to a 28’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a pallet of metal beams had tipped over and punctured the side of the tote. The crew performed a tote transfer and cleaned the impacted trailer floor using Simple Green, granular absorbent pads. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with impacted absorbents into (2) 55- gallon poly drums, (2) 55 poly drum contains oil dri, (1) 55-poly drum contains product only. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
